availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James Keenan (Louisville, Jefferson County, Kentucky, shoe salesman.)

body.p: Louisville, Jefferson County, Kentucky, shoe salesman. Charged with robbing George Gross in Louisville Police Court in December 1862. Acquitted of robbery in Jefferson Circuit Court in May 1863. Proprietor of the Cincinnati Boot and Shoe Store in Louisville in 1864.

ab.bibl:
"Police Proceedings," The Louisville Daily Journal (Louisville, KY), December 20, 1862, p. 1.
"Jefferson Circuit Court, Criminal Term," The Louisville Daily Journal (Louisville, KY), January 15, 1863, p. 3.
"Jefferson Circuit Court," The Louisville Daily Journal (Louisville, KY), May 7, 1863, p. 3.
J.D. Campbell's Louisville Business Directory, for 1864: With an Appendix of Much Valuable Information, Carefully Compiled from Original Sources, a Summary of the Nation Tax Law, &c., &c. (Louisville, KY: L.A. Civill, 1864), 88.
